poem:
**Pedal Through the Strike**  

In the labyrinth of London,  
where the city hums and pauses,  
riders spin through the stratum,  
gears clicking beneath a global sigh.  

Each revolution a rhythmic verse,  
whirring past stalled rails,  
breathing part rebellion,  
part necessity—  
wheels tracing the city's spine,  
an eloquent cadence  
against the noise-stricken air.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rising costs push John Lewis Partnership into deeper loss; London tube strike enters fourth day – business live 10.27am BST London commuters have increasingly been cycling to work because of this week’s Tube strike, new figures show. New figures from employee benefits provider YuLife showed that cycling miles tracked across London have jumped by 32% this week, from 3,878 to 5,120 miles, as workers turn to their bikes to beat the chaos, PA Media reports.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
